conclusion: A, B, and C are the sources where liquid flows out.
The liquid flows downward and interacts with the baffles (angled barriers) in the system.
The baffles guide the liquid toward specific containers at the bottom (D, E, F, G).
Liquid from A (pink) flows downward and hits the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle redirects the liquid from A toward the left.
Liquid from A ultimately flows into container E.
Liquid from B (green) flows downward and hits the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle redirects the liquid from B toward the right.
Liquid from B ultimately flows into container F.
Liquid from C (blue) flows downward and hits the blue baffle.
The blue baffle redirects the liquid from C straight downward.
Liquid from C ultimately flows into container G.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container F.
Liquid from C flows into container G.
